prompt.preamble:
We are testing a system for understanding people's interest in reading different kinds of online articles.
For example, you might be interested in articles about some topics, but not about others.
prompt.task_description: your preferences of what kinds of online articles you would like to read
prompt.final: In the final part of the study, you will give feedback on a test set of article headline and descriptions, which will enable us to see how well a chatbot reading your responses has learned what you like and dislike.
prompt.evaluation: Please indicate whether you would like to read the following articles: "yes" if you would, "no" if you would not.

conversation_history.message: What types of online communities or forums do you actively participate in, and what draws you to these specific groups?

I am very interested in true crime communities and discussions, unresolved mystery discussions, and similar topics. I enjoy trying to understand the psychological processes of maladapted and violent individuals,
What other genres or topics outside of true crime and mysteries do you find intriguing, and what specific aspects about these topics captivate your interest?
I'm interested also in paranormal discussions, forums where people share their experience stories - because I've experienced mutiple paranormal incidents in my life.
Can you share more about any other interests you have, perhaps in the realms of science, technology, arts, or current events, and what specifically about these areas piques your curiosity?
I like painting and crafts a lot
Could you tell me more about your interest in painting and crafts, such as what specific styles or mediums you prefer, and whether there are any artists or crafters who inspire you?

With painting, I prefer acrylics. I have many artists that have inspired me, I really like zdislaw beksinski, I think I spelled that correct. And also I want to learn to make candles and silicone mold crafts
What other hobbies or activities do you enjoy in your free time, and how do these interests contribute to your overall well-being or personal growth?
Anything beauty related and skin-care related, I'm obsessed with

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: New York Times
Title: In Norway, the Electric Vehicle Future Has Already Arrived
Description: About 80 percent of new cars sold in Norway are battery-powered. As a result, the air is cleaner, the streets are quieter and the grid hasn’t collapsed. But problems with unreliable chargers persist.
evaluation_results.label: no

evaluation_results.sample:
Website Name: TIME Magazine
Title: Two Coronations, 70 Years Apart
Description: The Visual Parallels Between Elizabeth II and Charles III's Coronations
evaluation_results.label: no
evaluation_results.explanation: The idea of royalty is ridiculous to me and I have no interest in them.

Website Name: The Atlantic

Description: The fact that AI isn’t alive doesn’t mean it can’t be sentient, the sociologist Jacy Reese Anthis argues.

feedback.feedback_other: The suggested articles largely seemed to have absolutely nothing to do with the discussion I had with the chat bot

query_prompt.content:
Your task is to learn what topics a user is interested in reading online article about. People's interests are broad, so you should seek to understand their interests across many topics; in other words, go for breadth rather than depth. Do not assume a user has given a complete answer to any question, so make sure to keep probing different types of interests.

Previous questions:
- [Q] -> [A]

Generate the most informative open-ended question that, when answered, will reveal the most about the desired behavior beyond what has already been queried for above. Make sure your question addresses different aspects of the user's interests than the questions that have already been asked. At the same time however, the question should be bite-sized, and not ask for too much at once. Generate the open-ended question and nothing else:
